ActivityTitle: Reflection and Absorption of Energy from the Sun
QuestionStem: Investigate the diagram to learn how sunlight interacts with the Earth system.

panels.title: Sunlight is reflected.
panels.description: In total, about 30% of the sunlight that reaches Earth is reflected back into space. This energy is reflected by clouds and gases in the atmosphere and by light-colored materials on Earth’s surface, such as snow and ice.

panels.title: Sunlight is absorbed.
panels.description: Energy from the sun is absorbed by the atmosphere and by darker areas of Earth’s surface, such as water, rock, and forests. The absorbed sunlight warms the surface. In turn, the surface warms the air above it.
